member.summary: The server and client are disconnected.

member.summary: The server and client are establishing a connection.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ConnectionState.Connected
member.summary: The server and client are connected and can send and receive data.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ConnectionState.Disconnecting
member.summary: The server and client are closing the connection.
member.remarks: This state might not be used by a connection and may be skipped over.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ConnectionState.Interrupted
member.summary: The server and client were connected but a fault has broken the connection. The entities are trying to reconnect.
member.remarks: This state might not be used by a connection.

member.name: T:DarkRift.DarkRiftReader
member.summary: Helper class for converting byte buffers into their original components during deserialization.

remarks.para: Not thread safe as the read order is critical!
This class implements IDisposable as it is a recyclable object, if you call Dispose the class will be recycled and so it is not compulsory to call Dispose.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher
member.summary: Dispatcher for running tasks on the main thread.
member.remarks: The dispatcher is used by DarkRift to move code to the main thread to be executed, either for convienience for programmers that do not know how to use multithreading safely or for use on frameworks where execution across multiple threads is not allowed. Similarly other DarkRift code can also make use of the dispatcher if they require threads to merge execution.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.WaitHandle
member.summary: A wait handle for new dispatcher jobs.
member.remarks: This is released when a new task is assigned to the dispatcher and so can be used to hold the task executing thread idle until a job is posted rather than constantly consuming resources.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.tasks
member.summary: The tasks that need executing.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.jobMutex
member.summary: The mutex for new jobs in the queue.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.executorThreadID
member.summary: The ID of the thread that is executing tasks.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.ExceptionsOnExecutorThread
member.summary: Whether exceptions should be raised on the executor thread.
member.remarks: When set true, any unhandled exceptions that are rasised during the execution of a task will be unsurpressed and thrown on the thread executing the tasks. The exceptions thrown within task executions can still be retreived by accessing the task object.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.Count
member.summary: The number of items waiting to be dispatched.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Dispatcher indicating whether exceptions should be thrown on the executing thread and setting the executor thread to the calling thread.
member.param: Whether exceptions should be thrown from the executing thread.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Dispatcher indicating whether exceptions should be thrown on the executing thread and specifying the executor thread.
member.remarks: This overload allows the executor thread ID to be passed in so that a specific thread can be chosen. If the thread specified tried to enqueue a task it will immediately be processed synchronously to protect against deadlocks. No other threads can be used to call . To disable this functionaility pass -1 as the thread ID.
member.param: Whether exceptions should be thrown from the executing thread.
The thread that will be dequeueing tasks.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeWait(System.Action)
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread and waits until it has completed.
member.remarks: If an exception occurs during the processing of the action the event will be re-thrown by this function for you to handle.
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeWait``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread and waits until it has completed
member.remarks: If an exception occurs during the processing of the function the event will be re-thrown by this function for you to handle.
member.returns: The result of the function executed.
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task.

member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task when completing synchronously.

member.name: T:DarkRift.ObjectCacheHelper
member.summary: Helper class for the object cache.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCacheHelper.InitializeObjectCache(DarkRift.ObjectCacheSettings)
member.summary: Initializes the object cache.
member.remarks:
Normally, initializing the object cache is handled for you when you create a server or client however there are times when it is necessary to initialize it without creating a server or client such as during testing. This method can be used to initialize the cache in those circumstances.
If the cache is already initialized this method will do nothing.
